talk.author: did:plc:biopwmcxye3l5r6hgk6zbeu7
talk.utter: Many doctors and nurses did just that at the beginning of AIDs. We stole meds, beds and wheelchairs and opened our own safe secret clinics.  But it was easier then in the late 70s early 80s. Not as many computers.

talk.author: did:plc:u7kz76a7tywtmnkzodn7mlwh
talk.utter: How many fascist governors were there in the 70s and 80s? How many docs treating AIDS patients were threatened with up to 99 years in prison? None that I can remember.

talk.author: did:plc:biopwmcxye3l5r6hgk6zbeu7
talk.utter: That was not the same. Healthcare institutions chose not to see or treat on their own. The government chose to ignore.  Reagan never said the word AIDS. Those who did see AIDs patients just lost their practice if word got out.  No one wanted to be in same rooms.

talk.author: did:plc:biopwmcxye3l5r6hgk6zbeu7
talk.utter: We do sometimes.  And right now, there are doctors and nurses who are forced to bend the truth in a record to give needed healthcare in many states where it really matters what the chart says for next steps.

talk.author: did:plc:6c7edzlxccnun75kximgjfad
talk.utter: I don’t think that if the time comes when a doctor is prosecuted for saving a life, that a jury will convict.

talk.author: did:plc:biopwmcxye3l5r6hgk6zbeu7
talk.utter: I think we’re going to find out. Sadly.
